position.marginalia_text: Ciceronis triduum: Scaligeri trihorium. Aurearum horarum aurea negociatio.

marginalia.translation: The three days of Ciceco: the three hours of Scaliger.

position.marginalia_text: Benè: sed non satis benè, si quid potes meliùs. Optimè; sed no[n] satis optimè, si quis potest melius.

marginalia.translation: Well, but not well enough, if there is something you can do better. Optimal, but not optimal enough, if anyone can do better.

position.marginalia_text: Sola prudentissima, aut validissima perdura[n]t in precio; phantastica citò euanescunt, aut vana vllo modo.

marginalia.translation: Only the most prudent and valid things endure in value; imaginary or vain things quickly vanish in some way.

position.marginalia_text: Communia satis docet sensus communis: et Ethica ferè omnia in Martinij Juliano. Aut ca[e]tera demonstrat pra[e]stantissimorum virorum Curiosa Obseruatio.

marginalia.translation: Common sense teaches common things sufficiently: and generally all ethics in Martinius' edition of Julian. Or the careful observation of the most excellent men demonstrate the remainder.

position.marginalia_text: Vulgaria faciunt vulgarem: rara rarum: singularem tantumm[od]o singularia.

marginalia.translation: Vulgarities make vulgar: rare things make rare: singular things only make singular.

position.marginalia_text: Philosophus est Pa[e]dantius, qui non est Aristippus, Rabela[e]sius, Apollonius plus quàm
Vertumnus. Nec Valla, nec Rodolphus, nec Viues, nec Melanchthon, nec Ramus, nec Bodinus, nec ullus "
" neotericoru[m] satis ciuilis, vrbanus, aulicus, pragmaticus, Cosmopoliticus, polyda[e]dalus, panergus.

marginalia.translation: A philosopher, who is not Aristippus, Rabelais, or Apollonius more than Vertumnus, is pedantic. Neither Valla, Rodolphus Agricola, Juan Luis Vives, Melanchton, Ramus, Bodin, or any of the moderns is civil, urbane, courtly, pragmatic, cosmopolitan, many-skilled, or all-effective enough.
